answers.answer: A doctor needs to exam your hand to rule out neuropathy caused by diabetes. To me, and I'm no doctor, it sounds like you're experiencing arthritic pain. While soaking your hand in warm water try these suggestions - http://tinyurl.com/hand-pain-treatmentAlso, try posting on MH arthritis forums. Good luck

question: I have been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes a couple of years ago. I am taking Victoza shots every morning and my diabetes usually runs under the 100s. A while ago my right hand has been falling asleep and I try to exercise daily for 30 minutes. But just recently I wake up and now it is not only falling asleep but full of pain. I have never had it hurt like this constantly unless I take Naproxen and that helps take the pain away for a few hours. But I mostly wake up with this strong pain in my hand even in the middle of the night.When I put my hand under scalding hot water it makes my hand feel real good.What do you think:?Angela
title: Diabetes and pain in right hand
